info.title: Open Education API
info.description: OpenAPI (fka Swagger) specification for the Open Education API. The model provides an overview of how the objects on which the API is specified are related. The overarching concept educations is not found in the in the end points of the API. The smaller concepts of programOffering, courseOffering and conceptOffering are all found in the offering endpoint. The different types of association can all be found in the association endpoint. The program relations object is not found as a separate endpoint but relations between programs can be found within the program endpoint by expanding that endpoint. Information about earlier meetings and presentations can be found here Information on the EDU-API model that was also used for this api is shown here

tags.name: service metadata
tags.description: The service API provides additional metadata needed to make the OOAPI fit for this organization.

tags.name: academic sessions
tags.description: The academic sessions API provides information about the different time periods a program can be offered.

tags.name: associations
tags.description: The associations API provides information about the association between an offering and a person (e.g. students, lecturers, etc).

tags.name: buildings
tags.description: The building API provides a building that is currently used by the organization. Including all location details.

tags.name: courses
tags.description: The courses API provides a self-contained and formally structured learning experience. Aimed at providing learning outcomes to students. Usually placed in the context of a program.

tags.name: components
tags.description: The components API provides information about components being part of parent courses.

tags.name: news
tags.description: The news API provides news feeds and items regarding a specific subject.

tags.name: offerings
tags.description: The offerings API provides information about offerings which have a global timeframe, e.g. a period to which students can enroll.

tags.name: organizations
tags.description: The organizations API provides the organizations that are responsible for the execution and recognition of education.

tags.name: persons
tags.description: The persons API provides information about persons related to an organization.

tags.name: programs
tags.description: The programs API provides a coherent set of educational components, aimed at the realization of competences or objectives in the field of knowledge, insight, attitudes and skills that the person who completes the program must have.

tags.name: rooms
tags.description: The rooms API provides the part of a building where an activity can take place. Including detail information on the resources available, number of seats, etc. (Updated continuously)

tags.name: about identifiers
tags.description: All identifiers should be globally unique for the scope of an institute. This should be guaranteed automatically, when using UUID's as prescribed by this specification.

tags.name: query information (use of q)
tags.description:
Endpoints can be searched using the q parameter. This parameter acts as a filter for the endpoint it filters items having a: * name, * abbreviation or * description or for persons: * givenName * surNamePrefix * surname * displayName * initials * mail * secondaryMail containing the given search term (exact partial match, case insensitive) # Examples 

GET /programs?q=stud

Result:
{
  "programId": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
  "type": "alliance",
  "name": "Student Mobility",
  "abbreviation": "studM",
  "description": "program that is a place holder for all courses that are made available for student mobility",
  "ects": 5,
  "qualificationAwarded": "None",
  "lengthOfProgram": 6,
  "levelOfQualification": 6,
  "sector": "university education",
  "fieldsOfStudy": "0732",
  "crohoCreboCode": "59312",
  "profileOfProgram": "the program is meant to be a place holder for all courses that can be exchanged between Universities, therefore there is no main focus for this program",
  "learningOutcomes": [
  "string"
  ],
  "admissionRequirements": "Students need to be enrolled at qualifying institutions of higher education that participate in this alliance",
  "qualificationRequirements": "None",
  "link": "https://bijvak.nl",
  "ext": { }
}

tags.name: expand information
tags.description:
Most endpoints also provide additional information which is not provided by default. To obtain this information we use an expand mechanism

# Endpoints which are expandable
* academic-session
* association
* component
* component-offering
* course
* course-offering
* organization
* program
* program-offering
* room

# Examples
First expand the program only to show additional parent information:
```
GET /programs/{programId}?expand=parent

Result:
{
"programId": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
"type": "alliance",
"name": "Student Mobility",
"abbreviation": "studM",
"description": "program that is a place holder for all courses that are made available for student mobility",
"ects": 5,
"qualificationAwarded": "None",
"lengthOfProgram": 6,
"levelOfQualification": 6,
"sector": "university education",
"fieldsOfStudy": "0732",
"crohoCreboCode": "59312",
"profileOfProgram": "the program is meant to be a place holder for all courses that can be exchanged between Universities, therefore there is no main focus for this program",
"learningOutcomes": [
"string"
],
"admissionRequirements": "Students need to be enrolled at qualifying institutions of higher education that participate in this alliance",
"qualificationRequirements": "None",
"link": "https://bijvak.nl",
"ext": { },
"parent": {
  "programId": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
  "type": "alliance",
  "name": "Student Mobility",
  "abbreviation": "studM",
  "description": "program that is a place holder for all courses that are made available for student mobility",
  "ects": 5,
  "qualificationAwarded": "None",
  "lengthOfProgram": 6,
  "levelOfQualification": 6,
  "sector": "university education",
  "fieldsOfStudy": "0732",
  "crohoCreboCode": "59312",
  "profileOfProgram": "the program is meant to be a place holder for all courses that can be exchanged between Universities, therefore there is no main focus for this program",
  "learningOutcomes": [
  "string"
  ],
  "admissionRequirements": "Students need to be enrolled at qualifying institutions of higher education that participate in this alliance",
  "qualificationRequirements": "None",
  "link": "https://bijvak.nl",
  "ext": { }
}
}
```

When additional information is needed on a program the program information can be expanded further by including additional parameters in an array style. If no values are provided for expand there will be no additional information provided. An empty expand parameter will be handled in the same manner as the normal GET function to the API.


```
GET /programs/{programId}?expand=parent,children,organization

Result:
{
"programId": "123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000",
"type": "alliance",
"name": "Student Mobility",

  "type": "alliance",

  "abbreviation": "studM",
```

tags.name: sorting information
tags.description:
Most endpoints provide sorting. To sort you can sort on the elements that are specified per endpoint. All elements can be sorted ascending by default o descending,
by adding "-" in front of the element to be sorted. The sorting takes place based on comma separated values. e.g.:

```
GET /programs?sort=programId
```
provides a list of all programs sorted ascending based on programId
```
GET /programs?sort=name,-ects
```
provides a list of all programs first sorted on name ascending and ects descending

tags.name: extension information
tags.description: Most endpoints can be extended. This can be done by providing the extended information in the designated "ext" area of the endpoint. All users of the OOAPI are encouraged to feed their extensions back to the OOAPI working group so this information can be used as feedback for future versions of the OOAPI.

tags.name: Error responses
tags.description:
Error responses are formatted in the `problem+json` media type ([RFC7807](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807)):
```
{
  "status": 404,
  "title": "A short, human-readable summary of the problem type, e.g. 'resource not found'."
  "detail": "An optional human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem."
}
```

tags.name: Multi-lingual support
tags.description: The OOAPI specifcation relies on the HTTP content negotiation mechanism to specify how a client can request information in a specific (natural) language, and how a server should respond to that request. In short: a client adds an `Accept-Language` header to their request, which the server uses to determine in what language the requested content should be returned. More information about this mechanism can be found at [Mozilla MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Accept-Language).

acceptLanguage.name: Accept-Language
acceptLanguage.description: The Accept-Language request HTTP header advertises which languages the client is able to understand, and which locale variant is preferred. See [Mozilla MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Accept-Language) for more information.

pageSize.name: pageSize
pageSize.description: The number of items per page

pageNumber.name: pageNumber
pageNumber.description: The page number to get. Page numbers start at 1.

personSearch.name: q
personSearch.description: Filter by persons having a givenName, surNamePrefix, surname, displayName, initials, mail or secondaryMail containing the given search term (exact partial match, case insensitive)

search.name: q
search.description: Filter by items having a name, abbreviation or description containing the given search term (exact partial match, case insensitive)

Service.description: A metadataset providing details on the provider of this OOAPI implementation

contactEmail.description: Contact e-mail address of the service owner

specification.description: URL of the API specification (YAML or JSON, compliant with [Open API Specification v3](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/))

documentation.description: URL of the API documentation, including general terms and privacy statement

Problem.description: A system message including the error code and an explanation

title.description: A short, human-readable summary of the problem type

detail.description: A human-readable explanation specific to this occurrence of the problem

personAffiliations.description:
The affiliations of this person, the relations a person has with the organization providing this endpoint
- student: student
- employee: medewerker
- guest: gast

postalType.description:
Address type
- postal: post
- visit: bezoek
- deliveries: bezorg

additional.description: Further details like building name, suite, apartment number, etc.
additional.example: On the other side of the road

geolocation.description: Geolocation of the entrance of this address (WGS84 coordinate reference system)

ICERelationType.description: Type of relation between person and In Case of Emergency contact

Person.description: A person that has a relationship with this institution

givenName.description: The first name of this person

surnamePrefix.description: The prefix of the family name of this person

surname.description: The family name of this person

displayName.description: The name of this person which will be displayed

dateOfBirth.description: The date of birth of this person, RFC3339 (full-date)

cityOfBirth.description: The city of birth of this person

countryOfBirth.description: The country of birth of this person the country code according to [iso-3166-1-alpha-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2)

nationality.description: The nationality of this person the nationality according to https://gist.github.com/zspine/2365808

dateOfNationality.description: The date of nationality of this person, RFC3339 (full-date)

mail.description: The primary e-mailaddress of this person

secondaryMail.description: The secondary e-mailaddress of this person

telephoneNumber.description: The telephone number of this person

mobileNumber.description: The mobile number of this person

photoSocial.description: The url of the informal picture of this person

photoOfficial.description: The url of the official picture of this person

titlePrefix.description: A title prefix to be used for this person

titleSuffix.description: A title suffix to be used for this person

office.description: The name of the office where this person is located

ICEName.description: Full name of In Case of Emergency contact

ICEPhoneNumber.description: Phone number of In Case of Emergency contact

languageOfChoice.description: The language(s) of choice for this person, RFC3066

associationRole.description:
The role of this person associated with the offering
  - student: student
  - lecturer: docent
  - teaching assistant: studentassistent
  - coordinator: coördinator
  - guest: gast

Association.description: A relationship between a person object and an offering

Result.description: A result as part of an association

score.description: The score of this program/course/component association (based on resultValueType in offering)

resultDate.description: The date this result has been published, RFC3339 (full-date)

ects.description: The number of EC's that have been earned to the current moment

AcademicSession.description: A period in time during which an offering can take place. Academicsessions can be nested.

academicSessionId.description: Unique id for this academic session

name.description: The name of this academic session

startDate.description: The day on which this academic session starts, RFC3339 (full-date)

endDate.description: The day on which this academic session ends, RFC3339 (full-date)

resultValueType.description: The result value type for this offering

Offering.description: Either a program, course or component offering which descrbes the program, course or offering in time

name.example: Final written test for INFOMQNM for fall semseter 2020

abbreviation.description: The abbreviation or internal code used to identify this offering

description.example: Prove in wirting knowledge of research methods, including: Acquire knowledge of HCI research paradigms Able to design suitable research studies (e.g., choose between within and between subject designs) Define/apply/design metrics and scales Define/produce materials (e.g., stimuli and questionnaires) Define protocols for research studies Understands and take in account concepts of reliability and validity Analyze and improve methods and analysis of published scientific articles Able to deliver scientific reports Prove in writing knowledge of ­­­statistics, including: Handle hypothesis testing with complex designs (e.g., including , dependent, independent, and co variates) Data preparation (e.g., coding and feature selection) Reason towards adequate techniques to ensure valid outcomes (e.g., be aware of type I, type II errors) Select an appropriate sampling method (e.g., stratified) Perform parametric tests (e.g., repeated measures (M)ANOVA) Perform non-parametric tests (e.g., Chi-square, Mann-Whitney, and Kruskal-Wallis)

mainLanguage.description: The main language in which the courses within this program are given, RFC3066

maxNumberStudents.description: The maximum number of students allowed to enroll for this offering

enrolledNumberStudents.description: The number of students that have already enrolled for this offering

pendingNumberStudents.description: The number of students that have a pending enrollment request for this offering

isLineItem.description: Whether the offering is a line item or not

modeOfStudy.description:
Indicate whether the course is full-time, part-time, dual or self-paced.
  - full-time: fulltime
  - part-time: parttime
  - dual training: duaal
  - self-paced: eigen tempo

startDate.description: The moment on which this offering starts, RFC3339 (full-date)

endDate.description: The moment on which this offering ends, RFC3339 (full-date)

ects.description: The number of EC's that is earned

startDate.description: The moment on which this offering starts, RFC3339 (full-date)

endDate.description: The moment on which this offering ends, RFC3339 (full-date)

weight.description: The weight to 100 as total for this offering in the course

roomType.description:
The type of this room
- general purpose: algemeen
- lecture room: collegezaal
- computer room: computerruimte
- laboratory: laboratorium
- office: kantoor
- workspace: werkruimte
- exam location: tentamenruimte
- study room: studieruimte
- examination room: onderzoekskamer
- conference room: vergaderkamer

Room.description: An area within a building where education can take place

abbreviation.description: The abbreviation of the name of this room

totalSeats.description: The total number of seats located in the room

availableSeats.description: The total number of available (=non-reserved) seats in the room

floor.description: The floor on which this room is located

wing.description: The wing in which this room is located

geolocation.description: Geolocation of the entrance of this room (WGS84 coordinate reference system)

startDateTime.description: The moment on which this offering starts, RFC3339 (date-time)

endDateTime.description: The moment on which this offering ends, RFC3339 (date-time)

resultWeight.description: The result weight of this offering

Organization.description: A description of a group of people working to gether to achieve a goal

description.description: Any general description of the organization should clearly mention the type of higher education organization, especially in the case of a binary system. In Dutch; universiteit (university) or hogeschool (university of applied sciences).
description.example: SURF is een coöperatieve vereniging van Nederlandse onderwijs- en onderzoeksinstellingen waarin de leden hun krachten bundelen. De leden zijn eigenaar van SURF.

brin.description:
BRIN-code of this organization
-00BX (BRIN-nummer instelling)
-26ED00 (BRIN-nummer vestiging)
-10305 (nummer Bevoegd Gezag)
-641 (nummer Administratie Kantoor)

allOf.description: These properties are only present when explicitly included

programType.description:
The type of this program
- program: opleiding
- minor: minor
- honours: honours
- specialization: specialisatie
- elective: keuzevak
- module: module
- track: track
- joint-degree: joint-degree
- alliance: alliance

qualificationAwarded.description: Type of qualificaton that can be obtained on finishing the program

levelOfQualification.description: Level of qualification according to the National Qualification Framework and the European Qualifications Framework

sector.description:
The sector for this program
- secondary vocational education: middelbaar beroepsonderwijs
- higher professional education: hoger beroepsonderwijs
- university education: universitair onderwijs

Program.description: A collection of courses that lead to a certifiable learning outcome

description.example: program that is a place holder for all courses that are made available for student mobility

ects.description: The number of Euopean Credits that can be archieved in this program

lengthOfProgram.description: The duration of this program in months

crohoCreboCode.description: CrohoCode in wo/hbo or creboCode in mbo

profileOfProgram.description: Brief description of the main focus of the program.
profileOfProgram.example: the program is meant to be a place holder for all courses that can be exchanged between Universities, therefore there is no main focus for this program

learningOutcomes.description: List of learning outcomes at program level. It is advisable to limit the number of learning outcomes to approximately 20. It is also advisable to make sure that the program learning outcomes in the course catalogue correspond with those on the Diploma Supplement.

admissionRequirements.description: This information may be given at an institutional level and/or at the level of individual programmes. Make sure that it is clear whether the information applies to fee-paying students (national and/or international) or to exchange students.
admissionRequirements.example: Students need to be enrolled at qualifying institutions of higher education that participate in this alliance

qualificationRequirements.description: Normally, students will receive a diploma when they have completed the (official) study program and have obtained the required number of credits. If there are any other specific requirements that students need to have fulfilled, mention them here.

level.description:
The level of this course (ECTS-year of study if applicable)
- secondary vocational education 3: mbo 3
- secondary vocational education 4: mbo 4
- associate degree: associate degree
- bachelor: bachelor
- master: master
- doctoral: doctoraal

modesOfDelivery.description:
The mode of delivery of the component (ECTS-mode of delivery)
- distance-learning: afstandsleren
- on campus: op de campus
- online: online
- hybrid: hybride
- situated: op locatie

Course.description: An object describing the metadata of a course

abbreviation.description: The abbreviation or internal code used to identify this course (ECTS-code)

ects.description: The number of EC's that is earned when the course is completed successfully (ECTS-ects)

description.example: As with all empirical sciences, to assure valid outcomes, HCI studies heavily rely on research methods and statistics. This holds for the design of user interfaces, personalized recommender systems, and interaction paradigms for the internet of things. This course prepares you to do so by learning you to collect data, design experiments, and analyze the results. By the end of the course, you will have a detailed understanding of how to select and apply quantitative research methods and analysis to address virtually all HCI challenges. Quantitative research and data analysis will be taught in the context of state-of-the-art HCI challenges. Lectures will be alternated with hands-on learning, including work with predefined datasets (e.g., addressing facial features, cognitive load, and emotion). Additionally, students will set up their own research (e.g., using eye tracking). Data processing and analysis will be executed using R.

learningOutcomes.description: Statements that describe the knowledge or skills students should acquire by the end of a particular course (ECTS-learningoutcome)
example: Executable knowledge of research methods, including: Acquire knowledge of HCI research paradigms Able to design suitable research studies (e.g., choose between within and between subject designs) Define/apply/design metrics and scales Define/produce materials (e.g., stimuli and questionnaires) Define protocols for research studies Understands and take in account concepts of reliability and validity Analyze and improve methods and analysis of published scientific articles Able to deliver scientific reports

Executable knowledge of ­­­statistics, including: Handle hypothesis testing with complex designs (e.g., including , dependent, independent, and co variates) Data preparation (e.g., coding and feature selection) Reason towards adequate techniques to ensure valid outcomes (e.g., be aware of type I, type II errors) Select an appropriate sampling method (e.g., stratified) Perform parametric tests (e.g., repeated measures (M)ANOVA) Perform non-parametric tests (e.g., Chi-square, Mann-Whitney, and Kruskal-Wallis)

requirements.description: The requirements needed to enter this course (ECTS-prerequisites)

enrollment.description: The extra information that is provided for enrollment

resources.description: An overview of the literature and other resources that is used in this course (ECTS-recommended reading and other sources)

assessment.description: A description of the way exams for this course are taken (ECTS-assessment method and criteria)

componentType.description:
The component type
- test: tentamen
- lecture: college
- practical: practicum
- tutorial: werkcollege
- consultation: consultatie
- project: project
- workshop: workshop
- excursion: excursie
- independent study: zelfstudie
- external: extern
- skills training: vaardighedentraining

Component.description: A component is a part of a course

description.example:
Prove executable knowledge of research methods, including: Acquire knowledge of HCI research paradigms Able to design suitable research studies (e.g., choose between within and between subject designs) Define/apply/design metrics and scales Define/produce materials (e.g., stimuli and questionnaires) Define protocols for research studies Understands and take in account concepts of reliability and validity Analyze and improve methods and analysis of published scientific articles Able to deliver scientific reports
Prove executable knowledge of ­­­statistics, including: Handle hypothesis testing with complex designs (e.g., including , dependent, independent, and co variates) Data preparation (e.g., coding and feature selection) Reason towards adequate techniques to ensure valid outcomes (e.g., be aware of type I, type II errors) Select an appropriate sampling method (e.g., stratified) Perform parametric tests (e.g., repeated measures (M)ANOVA) Perform non-parametric tests (e.g., Chi-square, Mann-Whitney, and Kruskal-Wallis)

parent.description: The parent Academicsession of this session (e.g. fall semester 20xx where the current session is a week 40)

year.description: The top level year of this session (e.g. 20xx where the current session is a week 40 of a semester)

allOf.description: These properties are only present when explicitly included. This allows for creating and displaying strutures of programs

parent.description: Parent program of which the current program is a child.

children.description: Programs which are a part of this program (e.g specializations)

organization.description: The organization providing the current course

allOf.description: These properties are only present when explicitly included

programs.description: The program of which this course is a part of

coordinators.description: The person(s) responsible for this course

organization.description: The organization providing the current course

allOf.description: These properties are only present when explicitly included

course.description: The course of which this component is a part

allOf.description: These properties are only present when explicitly included
These properties are only present when explicitly included
These properties are only present when explicitly included
These properties are only present when explicitly included

person.description: The person this association is to

offering.description: The offering this association is for

Building.description: An object describing a building and the properties of a building.

abbreviation.description: The abbreviation of the name of this building

allOf.description: These properties are only present when explicitly included.

building.description: The building in which the room is located

NewsFeed.description: A placeholder or collection of news items

newsFeedId.description: Unique id for this news feed

name.description: The name for this news feed

description.description: The description of this news feed
description.example: all information on what happens in room Bb 4.35

type.description: The type of the object this news feed relates to

newsItemType.description:
The type of this news item
- calamity: calamiteit
- general: algemeen
- schedule-change: roosterwijziging
- announcement: aankondiging

NewsItem.description: A newsitem contains the message and metadata of that message

newsItemId.description: Unique id for this news item

name.description: The name for this news item
name.example: Room Bb 4.35 will be un available from 2020-09-29 until 2020-09-30

authors.description: The authors of the article with this news item

image.description: The url containing the address of the image belonging to this news item

link.description: The url containing the address of the article belonging to this news item

content.description: The content of this news item
content.example: The room Bb 4.35 will be under maintenance

validFrom.description: The moment from which this news item is valid, RFC3339 (date-time)

validUntil.description: The moment until which this news item is valid, RFC3339 (date-time)

lastModified.description: The moment on which this news item was updated, RFC3339 (date-time)

get.description: Get metadata for the service.
Get an ordered list of all persons.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort by one or more attributes, the default is ascending. Prefixing the attribute with a minus sign `-` allows for descending sort. Examples: [ATTR | -ATTR | ATTR1,-ATTR2]

pageSize.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Returns the person object for the currently authenticated user.
Get a single person.

pageSize.description: The number of items per page

get.description: Get a list of all offerings for a given organization

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: Filter all offerings by providing a minimum start date for the corresponding academic session, RFC3339 (full-date). By default only future offerings are shown (equal to `?since=<today>`).

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: Filter all offerings by providing a maximum end date for the corresponding academic session, RFC3339 (full-date).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort by one or more attributes, the default is ascending. Prefixing the attribute with a minus sign `-` allows for descending sort. Examples: [ATTR | -ATTR | ATTR1,-ATTR2]

pageSize.description: The number of items per page

parameters.description: Filter by parent (academicSessionId), may be empty to retrieve all years (which have no parent)
